definition: as empty as anything (idiom); completely bereft/to have nothing/vacuous/hollow/empty (argument, head etc)
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation

sentences.english: The room is now completely bare.
sentences.chinese: 現在，整間屋子就空空如也了。

sentences.english: Eventually their rooms would be almost empty.
sentences.chinese: 最終，他們的房間幾乎空空如也。

sentences.english: Hell is empty, And all the devils are here.
sentences.chinese: 地獄空空如也，而所有的惡魔妖魅皆在此。

sentences.english: Pessimists note that one home in nine is still empty.
sentences.chinese: 悲觀主義者注意到，房子九中有一還是空空如也。

sentences.english: I looked at the empty table in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 我看着他面前空空如也的桌面。

sentences.english: Through the windows, he could see the empty interiors.
sentences.chinese: 他透過窗戶看到裏面空空如也。

sentences.english: My nephew,George,has a money box but it is always empty.
sentences.chinese: 我的外甥喬治有一個存錢罐，可裏面老是空空如也。

sentences.english: Finding nothing there, she withdrew it.
sentences.chinese: 發現其中空空如也時，她把手縮回來。

sentences.english: I need you , O I love U.
sentences.chinese: 沒有你在，我的心只能空空如也。

sentences.english: My mind remains idle, with only fragments of images drifting in and out.
sentences.chinese: 我頭腦空空如也，進進出出的都是那些映像的片斷。

sentences.english: You do not see people - it is like empty streets.
sentences.chinese: 你看不見人，街道上空空如也。

sentences.english: His barrow was empty. There were no hats in it.
sentences.chinese: 他的手推車空空如也，裏面沒有一頂帽子。

definition: to have disappeared/to be missing/nowhere to be found
to stuff full/to cram in/packed tight/chock full
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
